data: The neatly displayed material principally derives from the personal collection of a Librarian of Marsala (Salvatore Struppa) who also become honorary inspector of antiquities of the region. The ceramics mostly derive from early Lilybaeum (4-2 centuries BC) some architectural pieces and uninscribed cinerary urns. A stretch of 5th century AD road has been excavated and is on display in one room, and an entire room is given over to 8 Latin inscriptions from Lilybaeum
Via Ludovico Anselmi Correale - Complesso Monumentale San Pietro , 91025 Marsala (TP)
Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text: CIL

English translation

Alex Antoniou

Face a: Dedicated on the 7th day before the Ides of September. To Imperator Antoninus Augustus, consul for the fourth time, and Decimus Caelius Balbinus, consul for the second time, by the means of Marcus Antius Gratillianus, quaestor pro praetore of the province of Sicily, vir clarissimus.

Face b: To Imperator Caesar Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Pius Felix Invictus Augustus, with tribunician power for the 17th time, consular power for the 4th, proconsul and father of the fatherland. The colony of Helvia Augusta Lilybitanorum devotes this to his divine power and majesty.

Text: CIL

Face a: Dedicated on the 7th day before the Ides of September. To Imperator Antoninus Augustus, consul for the fourth time, and Decimus Caelius Balbinus, consul for the second time, by the means of Marcus Antius Gratillianus, quaestor pro praetore of the province of Sicily, vir clarissimus.

Face b: To Imperator Caesar Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Pius Felix Invictus Augustus, with tribunician power for the 17th time, consular power for the 4th, proconsul and father of the fatherland. The colony of Helvia Augusta Lilybitanorum devotes this to his divine power and majesty.
